How do i cancel a players contract with me? I want to get rid of the bad ones to get better players?
replyContent:
Hi Mike,

On the players contracts page (4th tab), there is a "Release" button which will cancel your contract with the player.

If you need any more help feel free to email footballagentgame@gmail.com and I'll help you out.

Really good game, couple things I noticed was that I found a lot of teams bought my players on 1.5yr deals, I always ask for renewal once it becomes under 12 months and they offer way below current salary. Doesn't make a lot of sense to pony up big for that long and then try to offer a massive pay cut after just 6 months into the deal. Other thing would be how you can't renegotiate with players on your cut of their earnings. Would be a really fun aspect to add as you do grow with some players.
Exceptional game. This game takes elements and ideas from football management games (E.g FM) and puts you in the shoes of an agent instead of a manager. Very addictive and fun game.

The intervals between upgrades and hq are huge and it's not easy to level them up after the 2nd level or so maybe more levels could be placed. Another thing it seems that there is game glitches where a team doesn't renew and then the player is a free agent and then no teams offer contracts to sign him. Other than that the game is solid, also I don't recommend wasting money as it doesn't really help out.

content: Simple game but excellently executed. Only flaw i have with the game hence the 4 stars not five. Is i would like a tab on the clubs to see reasons why they do/dont like me. I have clubs i have never interacted with who hate me and i cant work out why.
replyContent:
Hi,

That is most likely from offering players to the club. Every time you offer a player and a club does not make an offer it decreases your relationship with that club by a small amount. Over time these will eventually increase back to "normal".

Hope that helps.

content: I have some big name mangement sims on my phone, but this app is where I spend my time. Its great - a simple interface with a lot of depth. Its not always about getting the highest rated players. You might have 2 equally rated players but one is a miserable, perennial underacheiver and the other is great no matter where you put him, and the development difference between the two is huge. It takes some searching to find a real gem. Just a great game.
very boring not much depth

wish you added more countries to scout young players and i wish tou could see the leaderboard of other countries than just the country you started with apart from that its a addictive and a good time waster

I know fixing that would be a lot of added - seemingly not-so-important - work on the game, but the realism would help it.

Fun game, good time killer while on flights or in the airport. Big problem I have, which I've seen in other reviews, I give someone a base salary let's say 1000 dollars per week, the player improves in the 2 years till the next renewal. I renew and boom now the team only wants to give me 950 per week for the player at the max, which just pisses my client off. What changed, my player improved, why wont they even match the last wage they offered?
replyContent:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for your review. Hard to say for sure without looking at the specific situation but one explaination is that the player turns from hot prospect into a reserve or sub (i.e. they didnt improve enough) in which case the club would no longer want to pay the higher salary. If this is not the case drop me an email and I'll take a look.

content:
The game is amazing and extremely addictive but some options are limited. I 
believe that the game has so much potential and that can be achieved. Some 
ideas to the game would be: -being able to see other leagues from around 
the world and see the other clubs who are winning titles. -league tables 
with a point system like in real life because sometimes during the game you 
can see some teams go from 2nd to 10th. -game fixtures (example: Chelsea 4 
: 3 Arsenal ) to see how teams are doing. -Add some sort of Champions 
league or World Cup so that your clients can create attention 
internationally through good performances. -Goalkeepers never get 
cleansheats even if they are 99 rated which isn't realistic (no offense). 
-add a list of teams interested in signing your client to know which club 
you can offer your client to. -Strikers don't score many goals which makes 
it harder for them to develop. -Maybe add a team rating that can change 
throughout the years because sometimes there are really good teams that are 
relegated which seems kind of weird. -Lastly, please make the teams 
position in the league logical because once I loaned out half of my young 
prospects (all around 60 rated) to a 3rd league team and they got 
relegated!? ( which I thought made no sense). Anyways, even though I am 
asking for a lot of improvements, just take this as a compliment or as 
success because your game is amazing and that is the reason I bought in the 
first place and it deserves to be recognized.
replyContent: Thanks, I'm limited by chars here so can't respond to everything. There is a team rating which changes each season, if you advanced many years then some big teams could end up doing poorly. Teams also improve gradually over time to make sure the game progresses so a 60 rated player at the start is not necessarily equal to a 60 player many years in.

content:
The fact that your players get capped off at 99 annoys me, I want to see my 
players reach the 100 mark! I think it would also be cool to add an option 
to see the stats of your released players, at the time of their release. 
Other than that, this is game is killer, I'm addicted to it.
replyContent:
Nobody is perfect :-)

Thanks for the review & feedback.

Hi i love the game and purchased it. But it seems i cannot load from the trial game. Need  to start new one. Its very dissapointed seems i already get to far in trial version
replyContent:
Hi,

Please make sure the "Storage" permission is enabled for both free version and full version. Advance a week in the free version. Close the full version and reopen.

If you created a new game you will need to clear the data for the game, it won't check if there is an existing game.

Send an email to footballagentgame@gmail.com if you need help.

replyContent:
Hi Jay,

Thanks for the review and feedback. FYI in the full version you can start as many games as you want without losing progress. On the main screen just press the load button to see your saved games.

content: Really addictive! !

it doesnt make sense when a good player offered to clubs dont have any bidder for him,another thing that doesnt make sense is when you purposely made 5 90+ guy on the same team (ac milan) and they still sat in mid table and when they get offered good young player(85+) who is a free agent they chose older player who has less overall rating,fix the game dude
replyContent:
Hi yudhis,

Remember as the agent you only see accepted offers, his current club may wish to keep him and have rejected any offers. 

Second point could be due to a number of things such as the players position, form, experience, cost of wages. If you see this happen again take a screenshot and drop me an email and ill take a look.

content: Great game but the top clubs in England need to give more playing time to players and there needs to be more realistic transfers also think like international caps and stuff would be a cool little addition

replyContent:
Hi Grant,

You are able to offer a player to clubs as of the latest version, released last week (1.7). I have also signifcantly increased the amount of player names in the game, this may take a few seasons to be noticeable however.

content: Extremely addictive game, great for passing the time and one of my favourite mobile games. Constantly being update with new features. Fantastic!

Great game. But, when one of your players retire that's it, they aren't remembered in any history or anything , the stats are gone forever; there should be a "final overview of the players career" or something.  No national teams?   Only the English league has multiple divisions and you can see what position your team is in, why not even the Italian,  Spanish,  fra etc?   The Champions league should be in this game, players awards would be much appreciated. And many other things.  Great game.
replyContent:
Hi Andrea,

Thanks for the suggestions. 

The reason only one nation has multiple leagues is because adding more teams takes more processing and would result in a slower game. You can play in multiple divisions in other countries but you would need to start a game with that country as the main nation.

content: Amazing addictive game if you like football

content: The concept is great but game lacking the realistic point of view.  Good if enjoying making money but not to play the agent. Graphics & the interaction with club/client can improve. Agent should know clubs season objectives before accepting a contract. Consider including more stats like assists, national team & cups appearance.  Improve goals for strikers & clean sheet for keepers. Requests for money by the players are very silly. Name database very limited. Also the club should have some say on a transfer if there is a contract. Agent should be able to offer his client to a club & negotiate a goal/assist/clean sheet bonus in a contract.

Some suggestions to improve. 1. I should not be paying 200k to refill a fridge or buy a b day  present. 2. Every player has a gambling addiction/had a fight/committed a crime I think players should have personalities which would make these things more likely. E.g. forgetful would mean more fill fridge and b days. Reckless could be gambling issues. 3. Be able to view players on a team and try and poach them for your agency. 4. Sponsor money is really low for players that are 97 rated.
Great little time waster
replyContent:
Thanks for the review Robert. 

I'll address each point individually.

1) This will be available soon
3) I would consider them a late game purchase hence the high cost
2,4) Thanks for these suggestions, I agree they would be nice and I'll be considering them for future updates

content: I liked this game for a couple of days but after that was bored. Would of been fine free but not worth paying for.

I love the game but one small thing that annoys me is how a player will never play until they reach 40, the majority of players tend to retire at the same age so a bit of variety would make every player seem a bit more unique. Great game!
replyContent:
Hi Oisin,

Thanks for your review.

Players begin making a decision on retirement when then reach 35 with an increasing likely chance each year up to a max age of 40. You may just be seeing a similar retirement age because of a small sample. There's certainly no reason why a player can't play until 40, it's just less likely.

content: Very long game which isnt to bad

content: Bought this game after reading the overwhelming positive reviews by other people using my Google reward. As the pessimist I am, I thought the basic graphics would put me off: WRONG.  This game is one of the most underrated out there. It's not too hard yet not too easy at the same time, the game-play is a blast, and the dev team have obviously put their fair share of work into the game. The best thing about it is thanks to the incredibly cheap price of the game, there are no annoying ads to bore you from the game. A little tune-up graphics wise and the next big football game could be here.
replyContent: Thanks for the review Luke!

content: Very good game but could do with higher  wages and sponsers but would defo recommended it to anyone

content: This is a pretty good idea for a game,but i find it annoying that your expected to sort out your clients food bills,cctv troubles,legal highs and even having affairs.I'm trying to make money.The players should sort it out themselves.Ive got one on over 20k a week and im having to pay over 6k for his family to fly?
replyContent:
Hi Lee,

Based on the research I did it is very common for an agent to handle all that stuff. To quote an interview with a football agent "money speaks all languages and women, clubs and other blokes can generally be bought off"

Its up to you with whether you give in to your clients demands and pay, but you risk them becoming unhappy if you don't.

content: Had it since it had like 20 downloads, never been a problem, amazing!!!

content: A little basic but still quite addictive. With a bit more depth it would defo be 5 stars

Ways to improve: have other agents poaching your players (happens in real life), other contract bonuses e.g. appearance fee or goal bonus, if your relationship with a team becomes excellent you negotiate transfer deals for them,  and finally 3rd party ownership?
replyContent:
Hi Abdullah,

Sponsors will approach you with an offer for one of your clients. You can see which clients have interested sponsors by filtering clients by "Sponsor".

Thanks for your suggestions, I hope to be able to add some of them in the future. 3rd party ownership is very unlikely however as I think it's too complex for the scope of the game.

content: What a load of tosh

It's a great game, but the contracts aren't binding and the transfer window isn't enforced. If these issues are solved, it would be better. But it would also be nice to be able to tell the clients that I'm not giving them 1000% of their weekly contributions to take care of something for them, but I'll do maybe 100-300% of the cost.
replyContent:
Hi Ayrton,

Contracts with clients do not expire. Transfers can still happen outside the window (the player will join next window). Loans are not affected. Send me an email (footballagentgame@gmail.com) with more details if you believe this is not so

Costs are usually small to the client so, as in real life, the agent is expected to foot the bill.
